creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
description: drawing on small rectangle of paper with tilted purple square at center featuring an abstracted portrait; the text “free!” in white set within a red oblong shape overlaps the purple square at TL; small green rectangle floats over BRQ of purple square; abstracted face in ULC and to right center of purple square; two green “peaks” at URC; variety of shapes and lines make up rest of composition in green, yellow, red, blue, purple, and black pigments; there is a ½” strip at R edge of paper that is white save four distinct, vertically-oriented green rectangles; frame backing has “James Castle, jca 0674.20, CA 26219” written in black ink at TLC; printed label with artist name, title, medium, and dimensions affixed to backing along with “Knoedler & Company” label, framers label, a red ticket marked “sold,” and a side from an old ice cream box marked, “Home Dairies vanilla ice cream”
medium: Color of unknown origin and soot on off-white wax-coated cardboard with roughened surface (commercially printed Home Dairies vanilla ice cream carton)
provenance: [Knoedler Gallery, New York, until c. 2006; sold to Mersky]; Mary and Bob Mersky, Minneapolis (c. 2006-14; given to MIA).
title: Untitled (Free!)
